hero.title: Production-ready architecture for demanding financial teams.
hero.copy: HL Deals showcases how to deploy a modern production-ready stack: secure AWS infrastructure, automated deployment pipelines, and a frontend that scales globally. This page summarizes the engineering behind the demo for tech leads, recruiters, and decision makers.

snapshot.title: Stack snapshot
items: Backend: ASP.NET Core 8, EF Core, JWT
Infra: AWS VPC, CloudFront, ALB, ECS Fargate, RDS SQL Server
IaC & DevOps: Terraform, Docker, Amazon ECR

github.name: GitHub
github.description: Release branch with protected merges and required reviews for every deployment.

githubActions.name: GitHub Actions
githubActions.description: CI workflows that build the Angular SPA and publish static assets automatically.

codepipeline.name: AWS CodePipeline
codepipeline.description: Managed pipeline that sequences source, build, and deploy stages for the API.

codebuild.name: AWS CodeBuild
codebuild.description: Ephemeral build fleet compiling .NET, building Docker images, and pushing to ECR.

route53.name: Amazon Route 53
route53.description: Managed DNS with health checks and low-latency routing.

cloudfront.name: Amazon CloudFront
cloudfront.description: Global CDN serving the SPA with ACM certificates at the edge.

s3.name: Amazon S3
s3.description: Private object storage for static assets and backups.

alb.name: Application Load Balancer
alb.description: HTTPS load balancer routing secure traffic to the API.

ecs.name: Amazon ECS Fargate
ecs.description: Serverless container orchestration for .NET workloads on Fargate.

docker.name: Docker
docker.description: Container images produced in CI and reused locally for parity with production.

rds.name: Amazon RDS
rds.description: Managed SQL Server database with automated backups and high availability.

dotnet.name: .NET 8
dotnet.description: ASP.NET Core API runtime with enterprise-grade performance.

angular.name: Angular 17
angular.description: Modular frontend built with standalone components and Angular Material.

terraform.name: Terraform
terraform.description: Infrastructure as Code to reproduce environments consistently.

ecr.name: Amazon ECR
ecr.description: Private container registry with versioning and image scanning.

architecture.title: AWS architecture
architecture.note: TLS certificates come from ACM (us-east-1) and protect both CloudFront and the ALB.

clients.title: Users
clients.copy: Browsers and mobile apps. All traffic runs over HTTPS.

route53.title: Amazon Route 53
route53.copy: Alias hl-web → CloudFront. Alias hl-api → ALB.

cloudfront.title: Amazon CloudFront
cloudfront.copy: Serves the SPA. Origin Access Identity + ACM.

s3.title: Amazon S3
s3.copy: Private bucket hl-deals-web-dev. Static assets and index.html.

ecs.title: Amazon ECS Fargate
ecs.copy: ASP.NET Core 8 container. Minimal security group.

rds.title: Amazon RDS (SQL Server)
rds.copy: Managed instance. Access restricted to ECS SG.

pipeline.title: Automated deployment flow
pipeline.copy: Independent pipelines keep the API and UI deploying continuously without manual pushes.

api.title: API · AWS CodePipeline to ECS
api.copy: CodePipeline coordinates Docker image builds and deployments to ECS whenever the release branch advances.

source.title: Source phase
source.copy: GitHub commits on the release branch trigger an AWS CodePipeline execution.

build.title: Build phase
build.copy: AWS CodeBuild runs dotnet publish, docker build, and pushes the image into Amazon ECR.

deploy.title: Deploy phase
deploy.copy: Amazon ECS Fargate refreshes the running service with the new image behind the public ALB.

ui.title: UI · GitHub Actions to CloudFront
ui.copy: A GitHub Action compiles the Angular SPA, syncs S3, and invalidates CloudFront caches.

source.title: Source trigger
source.copy: Workflow runs whenever the release branch is updated in GitHub.

build.title: Build & package
build.copy: Installs dependencies, builds the production Angular bundle, and prepares static assets.

deploy.title: Deploy & invalidate
deploy.copy: Artefacts sync to the S3 origin bucket and CloudFront edge caches are invalidated globally.

security.title: Security & reliability
security.copy: The demo follows production-grade patterns: valid certificates, network segmentation, secret management, and reproducible deployments. It is designed to demonstrate audit-ready practices.
items: End-to-end encrypted traffic with ACM certificates.
Private S3 bucket accessible only through the Origin Access Identity.
JWT signed with rotatable keys and CORS configured for trusted clients.
Private subnets for ECS and RDS with minimal security groups.
Automated pipelines invalidate caches and roll out versioned artefacts across environments.
